goal: Generate a ~10K transaction QIF file with all entry types to test the parser and serve as sample data

steps.action: Create test file test/generate-qif.tap.js with test: Given a QIF generator, When generating reference data, Then it produces valid account/category/security records
Run test to confirm it fails
Create scripts/generate-comprehensive-qif.js with generateAccounts(), generateCategories(), generateSecurities(), generateTags(), generatePayees(), generateClasses()
Run test to confirm it passes
Add test: When generating bank transactions, Then it produces 7000 transactions with splits and transfers
Run test to confirm it fails
Implement generateBankTransactions() with payday income, bills, expenses, splits, transfers
Run test to confirm it passes
Add test: When generating investment transactions, Then it produces 3000 transactions with Buy/Sell/Div/Reinvest actions
Run test to confirm it fails
Implement generateInvestmentTransactions() with 401k contributions, dividends, rebalancing
Run test to confirm it passes
Add test: When serializing to QIF, Then output can be parsed by existing QIF parser
Run test to confirm it fails
Implement serializeToQIF() and all field formatters
Run test to confirm it passes
Generate comprehensive.qif to test/test-data/
Import via CLI and verify all entry types present
git status --short to check scope
Commit: 'Add comprehensive QIF generator for testing all entry types'

verification: All 9 entry types present (Account, Category, Class, Payee, Security, Tag, Price, TransactionBank, TransactionInvestment)
